Package co.cookies.sdk.storefront

Interface Storefront.MenuClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable, ServiceClient<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.MenuV1Client>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StorefrontClientV1.MenuClientV1
    Enclosing interface:
    Storefront
    public static interface Storefront.MenuClient
extends ServiceClient<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.MenuV1Client>
    Specifies the API surface for the Menu Service, a constituent part of the Cookies Storefront API, which is responsible for traversing catalog and inventory data to produce relevant localized product menus.

    The Menu API is aware of jurisdictional restrictions and support. For example, CBD products will not be shown in the United States unless an age gate parameter is passed that allows such menu items; additionally, user geo-location occurs to determine relevant retail locations nearby, unless an explicit location is provided.

    Whereas inventory operates on the individual item level, menus typically operate at the level of abstract products, meaning a single product may have multiple variants, as is the case with item types like apparel and flower (for example, apparel typically has sizes/colors and flower typically is sold at weight-driven size tiers). Via the Menu API, a "product" encompasses all variants and inventory for a given product group.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu()
      Generate a default menu payload for the detected context for this request; this will use server-side geo- location to determine the user's menu relevance, and then merge the resulting payload with globally-available inventory and catalog data.
      com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuRequest> rpc)
      Generate a custom menu request based on a developer-crafted protocol buffer, which considers the specified inventory channels, user location and account ID, content locale, and query settings; this method allows full control of the menu generation engine.
      default cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse menu​(SyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuRequest> rpc)
      Synchronously generate a custom menu request based on a developer-crafted protocol buffer, which considers the specified inventory channels, user location and account ID, content locale, and query settings; this method allows full control of the menu generation engine.
      default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(MenuRequestSpec options)
      Generate an advanced menu request specification based on a developer-crafted request spec, which considers the specified inventory channels, user location and account ID, content locale, and query settings; this method allows full control of the menu generation engine.
      default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(java.util.Optional<java.util.Locale> locale)
      Generate a default menu payload for the detected context for this request within the specified content locale and with server-side geo-location, used to determine the user's menu relevance, then merge the resulting payload with globally-available inventory and catalog data.
      default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(java.util.Optional<java.util.Locale> locale, cookies.schema.StoreKey store)
      Generate a store-specific payload for the detected context for this request within the specified content locale, and with server-side geo-location, used to determine the user's menu relevance, then merge the resulting payload with globally-available inventory and catalog data.
      com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.model.MenuSearchResultset> search​(AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuSearchRequest> rpc)
      Asynchronously perform a search across available menu items for a given context, based on arbitrary term input and any facet filters or regular filters applied by the user (or underlying code).

      Synchronously perform a search across available menu items for a given context, based on arbitrary term input and any facet filters or regular filters applied by the user (or underlying code).

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        @Nonnull
default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu()
        Generate a default menu payload for the detected context for this request; this will use server-side geo- location to determine the user's menu relevance, and then merge the resulting payload with globally-available inventory and catalog data.

        This default implementation route always opts to include menu content. See other menu method options to specify things like the content locale, user's location or ID, and store hints.

        Returns:
        Rendered menu payload across relevant inventory channels, decorated with global content.
        See Also:
        To specify a content locale.

      • menu

        @Nonnull
default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                   java.util.Optional<java.util.Locale> locale)
        Generate a default menu payload for the detected context for this request within the specified content locale and with server-side geo-location, used to determine the user's menu relevance, then merge the resulting payload with globally-available inventory and catalog data.

        This default implementation route always opts to include menu content. See other menu method options to specify things like the user's location or ID, and store hints.

        Parameters:
        locale - Content locale for the resulting menu payload. If the specified locale is unsupported, an error is returned to the invoking user.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu payload across relevant inventory channels, decorated with global content.
        See Also:
        To specify a content locale and retail store.

      • menu

        @Nonnull
default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                   java.util.Optional<java.util.Locale> locale,
                                                                                                   @Nonnull
                                                                                                   cookies.schema.StoreKey store)
        Generate a store-specific payload for the detected context for this request within the specified content locale, and with server-side geo-location, used to determine the user's menu relevance, then merge the resulting payload with globally-available inventory and catalog data.

        This default implementation route always opts to include menu content. See other menu method options to specify things like the user's location or ID, and store hints.

        Parameters:
        locale - Content locale for the resulting menu payload. If the specified locale is unsupported, an error is returned to the invoking user.
        store - Store for which the desired menu should consider inventory, and include entries (with content) for matching products.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu payload across relevant inventory channels, decorated with global content.
        See Also:
        To specify advanced menu request options.

      • menu

        @Nonnull
default com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                   MenuRequestSpec options)
        Generate an advanced menu request specification based on a developer-crafted request spec, which considers the specified inventory channels, user location and account ID, content locale, and query settings; this method allows full control of the menu generation engine.

        Simpler invocations exist on this interface which work based on a store key, or a content locale (which uses user location detection features).

        Parameters:
        options - Crafted RPC request spec object, which specifies the desired menu.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu payload across relevant inventory channels, decorated with global content.
        See Also:
        Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale., Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale and store key.

      • menu

        @Nonnull
default cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse menu​(@Nonnull
                                               SyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuRequest> rpc)
        Synchronously generate a custom menu request based on a developer-crafted protocol buffer, which considers the specified inventory channels, user location and account ID, content locale, and query settings; this method allows full control of the menu generation engine.

        Simpler invocations exist on this interface which work based on a store key, or a content locale (which uses user location detection features). An async variant of this method is also available, and should generally be preferred unless dispatching from a background thread.

        Parameters:
        rpc - Crafted RPC request payload, which specifies the desired menu, and is wrapped to execute and return asynchronously.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu payload across relevant inventory channels, decorated with global content.
        See Also:
        Asynchronous variant of this method., Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale., Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale and store key.

      • menu

        @Nonnull
com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.MenuResponse> menu​(@Nonnull
                                                                                           AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuRequest> rpc)
        Generate a custom menu request based on a developer-crafted protocol buffer, which considers the specified inventory channels, user location and account ID, content locale, and query settings; this method allows full control of the menu generation engine.

        Simpler invocations exist on this interface which work based on a store key, or a content locale (which uses user location detection features).

        Note: This method operates synchronously. Async variants exist and should generally be preferred unless dispatching from a background thread.

        Parameters:
        rpc - Crafted RPC request payload, which specifies the desired menu, and is wrapped to execute and return asynchronously.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu payload across relevant inventory channels, decorated with global content.
        See Also:
        Sychronous version of this method, for dispatch in a background thread., Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale., Convenience method if you just need to set the content locale and store key.

      • search

        @Nonnull
default cookies.schema.store.model.MenuSearchResultset search​(@Nonnull
                                                              SyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuSearchRequest> rpc)
        Synchronously perform a search across available menu items for a given context, based on arbitrary term input and any facet filters or regular filters applied by the user (or underlying code).

        Search results typically reference items via their CPIDs -- i.e. abstract product groups, which contain variants. When using this method, results are filtered based on live inventory signals.

        Parameters:
        rpc - Crafted RPC request payload for a menu search operation which is wrapped to execute synchronously.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu search results, based on the input parameters in the subject RPC request payload.
        See Also:
        Asynchronous variant of this method.

      • search

        @Nonnull
com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.model.MenuSearchResultset> search​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                          AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.MenuSearchRequest> rpc)
        Asynchronously perform a search across available menu items for a given context, based on arbitrary term input and any facet filters or regular filters applied by the user (or underlying code).

        Search results typically reference items via their CPIDs -- i.e. abstract product groups, which contain variants. When using this method, results are filtered based on live inventory signals.

        Parameters:
        rpc - Crafted RPC request payload for a menu search operation which is wrapped to execute synchronously.
        Returns:
        Rendered menu search results, based on the input parameters in the subject RPC request payload.
        See Also:
        Asynchronous variant of this method.
